text: A reducing agent is a chemical that gives away electrons to another chemical compound, the oxidizing agent. For example, zinc is a reducing agent. When it reacts with an oxidizing agent, it gives up two electrons, changing its oxidation state from 0 to +2. All chemical elements have an oxidation state of 0. ==Examples== *Tin(II) chloride *Zinc *Aluminum *Alkali metal *Sulfur *Hydrogen ==Related pages== *Oxidation *Reduction *Oxidizing agent Category:Chemistry
title: Reducing agent
